discussion.p: Exactly why does Semiregular exist, and what's the design criterion for deciding which of the requirements in Regular should be relaxed for Semiregular? Matt's first thought was that Semiregular was there to describe the "almost regular" value type of std::map, but that's wrong; in this terminology map's value type is neither Regular nor Semiregular. Mat wonders whether there are any algorithms that need to distinguish between Regular and Semiregular. A preliminary search shows no use of it in the latest revision of the concepts-in-clause-25 paper. Can we get rid of Semiregular? (Note: Semiregular is used in the definition of the InputIterator concept.)
